p: The oral supplementation of the ethanolic extracts from A. marina leaves 2 mg/gm exerted a significant hypoglycemic effect on streptozocin diabetic mice, similar to the effect of the aqueous and hydroalcoholic extract [ 30, 31, 32]. The possible mechanism underlying the antihyperglycaemic action of A. marina was attributed to inducing Î²-cells to release more insulin, and reducing oxidative stress by increasing the antioxidant activity of catalase, glutathione-S-transferase, and superoxide dismutase enzymes [ 28, 30, 31].
